info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 7:13PM EDT until May 27 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton and Dorchester.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from near Parkers Ferry Landing east through Delemar Crossroads, North Charleston and Daniel Island. As much as 1 to 3 inches of rain has fallen. An additional 1 to 2 inches could fall through 815 PM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, West Ashley, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Downtown Charleston and Daniel Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
